title: Chad McIntosh on Social Trinitarianism and Group Personhood
description:
Dr. Chad McIntosh has a PhD in Philosophy from Cornell University. He has developed a model of social trinitarianism complimented by a deeper understanding of group personhood. I feel like his model is one of the best and most compelling articulations of social trinitarianism that many people could learn from.  He also challenges me with arguments against Biblical Unitarianism. We mention Dale Tuggy, William Lane Craig, Augustine, Larry Hurtado, Bishop Barron, Cosmic Skeptic, Gregory of Nazianzus, Thomas Aquinas, Richard Bauckham, Richard Swinburn, and more.

00:00:00 - Chad's Introduction
00:11:30 - Scholarly interest in the trinity
00:15:40 - State of current trinitarian scholarship
00:19:20 - Necessary traits of a trinity theory
00:24:05 - Chad's view of the trinity
00:35:00 - Two kinds of persons
00:48:00 - Group personhood in the Bible
00:58:30 - Objection 1 Who is a God?
01:14:45 - Objection 2 What differentiates the persons of the Trinity?
01:31:30 - Chad's objections to Biblical Unitarianism
01:35:14 - Sam's response to objection 1 on history
01:44:55 - Sam's response to objection 2 on the atonement
01:49:45 - Sam's response to objection 3 God as social being
